description:
The 3 Cricketeers will show you how easy it is to bake and cook with crickets. Cricket powder is full of protein, prebiotic fiber, B12 and many other vitamins and minerals. This sustainable protein is a pantry staple powerhouse making all your dishes and recipes nutrient dense. Chad and Claire Simons, co-founders from 3 Cricketeers, will show you how to use cricket powder and demo featuring Executive Chef Marc Paavola from Bear Cave Brewery adding cricket powder to pizza dough. Demo times are 11a.m., 1 p.m., 3 p.m.

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.

description:
“Rake up! Sweep up! Pick up!” Get your photo taken defending a storm drain from runoff pollution. Join more than 12,800  adopters in Minnesota when you sign up to adopt a storm drain in your  neighborhood. You'll receive a yard sign that recognizes your commitment to keeping lakes and rivers clean. Plus, you'll get to name your drain and add its name to our poster. Stop by to play arcade games like air hockey and foosball that highlight the connection between Minnesota's changing climate and pollutants washing into storm drains. Find out why it's now more important than ever to take action to protect local waterways.

Located in Eco Experience.
name: Adopt-a-Drain

description:
With our sponsors, HeathPartners and the Savanna Institute, this year's exhibit theme is Agroforestry. As climate change continues to pose a threat to our food systems, sustainable agricultural practices have the power to mitigate and even reverse those threats. Agroforestry is a particularly effective practice as it integrates trees, perennials, pasture and even native species into more traditional farming practices. This exhibit will show how these systems create a resilient food shed and will explore ways we can all contribute to these sustainable systems.  Minnesota farmers and food-makers will be sampling their products. Kids will learn more about Minnesota-grown produce with hands-on activities. Minnesota chefs will teach us their favorite recipes using locally grown ingredients. Visit the website for a schedule of chefs.

Located in Eco Experience.
name: Agroforestry: Renewing the Countryside

description: Information about Air Force Recruitment, interactive activities, and free giveaways. Located on Wright Ave. between Underwood & Cooper streets.
name: Air Force Recruitment

description: Transportation and wood smoke are common sources of air pollution that can impact health. Visitors to the air quality exhibit will learn about changes they can make that will help reduce pollution and protect their health. New this year, visitors will learn about wood smoke pollution and easy ways to avoid building smoky fires. Returning this year, visitors can find out about air quality alerts, what to do when air quality is bad, and talk with the MPCA staff meteorologists behind the daily air quality forecasts. In the “electric garage,” visitors will learn how they can replace gas-powered equipment such as cars, lawn mowers and snow blowers with human or electric-powered versions and have a positive impact on the environment. Located in Eco Experience.
name: Air Quality & Reducing Air Pollution

description: The Aisle of Breeds, presented by the Minnesota Horse Expo and the Minnesota Horse Council, is in the center aisle of the Horse Barn and showcases different breeds and types of horses throughout the 12 days of the State Fair. description:
America’s favorite stunt dogs are returning to make a splash at the 2024 State Fair! From large to small breeds, these dogs will mesmerize you as they compete in challenges, dock dives and leaps into the air to catch flying discs, plus astounding stunts such as jumping rope, walking backwards and doing paw-stands. These canine stars are thrilling the nation – you may recognize them from “The Tonight Show,” “The Ellen DeGeneres Show,” “The Queen Latifah Show,” Animal Planet, National Geographic, the Rose Parade and television commercials. All-Star Stunt Dogs Splash participated in the “World Dog Awards” hosted by George Lopez on the CW, where jump-rope dog "Spitfire Spinelli" was one of the top three trick dogs on the show! What makes these stunt dogs so special? Besides their talent for flipping, jumping and diving, these amazing pooches have been adopted from shelters across the country and turned into stars. Their mission is to promote pet adoption and spaying and neutering, while encouraging responsible pet ownership. The louder you cheer, the more air the dogs get and the bigger the splash! Come join the “Dog-Gone Fun” happening daily.

ASL interpretation offered daily at 2 p.m.
name: All-Star Stunt Dogs Splash

description: Climate exhibits invite you to learn a little, play a little and leave with a good dose of hope that people can find solutions to climate change. Minnesota has a goal to reduce our emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases or carbon emissions to net-zero emissions by 2050. We are on track to meet greenhouse gas reduction goals for the first time, and there is a lot we can do to keep that momentum going. Located in Eco Experience.
name: Climate Change

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.

description: Darlene And The Boys is a classic country/variety band. They perform regularly on the RFD TV Network's "The Midwest Country Show." Darlene is a multiple winner of Nashville's "Be A Star” and has appeared on "The Shotgun Red" variety show at the Texas Troubadour Theater in Nashville. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR: Darlene And The Boys

name: Designing with Gladiolus

description: A gifted vocalist, songwriter and dancer, DiaToti channels the rich African storytelling tradition, invoking genuine emotions with every tune. She masterfully blends African music, accentuating it with the distinctive rhythms of Congolese sounds, ensuring every listener feels the vibrant pulse of Africa.
name: DiaToti

description: Minnesota has a rich history of interacting with the rocks and minerals under our feet. Want to know more about the 130-year history of iron mining? Did you know that some of America's first cars were built from steel produced from iron mined on the Iron Range and outfitted with windows made in Minneapolis from silica sand mined locally? Come learn about Minnesota’s unique geology. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR: Dig into Minnesota Geology

description:
Soils are crucial to our everyday lives, storing carbon, filtering water, growing plants, and so much more. Meet Minnesota soils and discover a whole new world beneath your feet through an interactive exhibit. Come see the soiled undies! Five pair of new men’s underwear fwere buried for about 10 weeks in a variety of different fields. Now they are chewed-up, ripped, torn, and riddled with holes. What happened? Why don’t they all look the same?

Located in Eco Experience.
name: Dig It! The Secrets of Soil

description: The annual DNR Commissioner’s Youth Awards will be given to an FFA student and 4-H member who have demonstrated initiative, leadership, creativity and achievement in conservation and the wise use of natural and agricultural resources. This is the 32nd year of this award program. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR Commissioner’s Youth Conservation Awards

description: DNR conservation officers will demonstrate how their dogs detect hidden wild game and fish, apprehend people, and give a special demo on finding invasive species zebra mussels on items. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR: K-9 Demonstration

description: Touch tables with Minnesota Zoo experts!
name: DNR: Minnesota Zoo

description: Known for performing familiar songs in their special style and with a twist of fun, Doctor Kielbasa is a veteran group of Minnesota musicians who love to play their unique, culturally influenced music that flows from the soul, creating a collective musical energy that is greater than any individual. Plan to dance and sing along to the lively and happy sounds of this popular Polish-style polka band!
name: Doctor Kielbasa

description: ​Pollinators help produce fruit like apples and cherries and vegetables like tomatoes and peppers. Insects also help clean water or reflect the health of the water that sustains our plants and food.​ ​Explore photos and actual insects so you can recognize them in your community with Dragon's Wynd.
name: Dragon's Wynd: Ecosystem Insects that Aid in Food Production

description:
Learn about where your drinking water comes from. Whether you are on a public drinking water system or a private well, your water may come from underground sources or from lakes or rivers. Pump water from an underground aquifer and see what happens as the water moves from below ground through a public water system.

Located in Eco Experience.
name: Drinking Water & Ground Water

description: Save money, your health and the planet by eating sustainability with Terry Gips of Alliance for Sustainability explains. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: Eating Sustainably

description: Music from the Andes with traditional rhythms from Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia and Columbia, as well as combined with more contemporary Latin and Caribbean rhythms. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR: Ecuador Manta

description: Twice as many e-bikes were sold in the U.S. in the last two years than electric cars. Based on availability and cost, it’s no surprise. It’s an affordable EV transportation option that offers accessibility as much as it provides fun transit. Great for those who can’t drive, don’t have access to a bus or train system, or anyone who wants to save money or help the environment while commuting, there’s an e-bike option for everyone. Talk to e-bike experts and owners from around the state as you learn about which features and options you should know about before buying your first or your next e-bike. Located in Eco Experience.
name: Electric Bikes: Climate-Friendly Transportation

description: Elgin is known for his pensive guitar music. His melancholic compositions are captivating and intimate. See him at Minnesota Wine Country.
name: Elgin Foster

description:
The Energy Information Center exhibit highlights state energy goals, priorities and opportunities for Minnesotans to directly benefit from state and federal energy programs, policies, rebates and incentives. This is a production of the Division of Energy Resources at the Minnesota Department of Commerce in partnership with the Clean Energy Resource Teams (CERTs), Minnesota’s GreenStep cities, tribal nations and schools and community partners. Key themes for 2024 include energy rebate and incentive programs, heat pump technologies and the latest solar programs. This exhibit will host the Energy Kids Zone, including a youth-focused energy quiz, an energy puzzle and free coloring books.

Located in Eco Experience.
name: Energy Information Center

description: Learn more about EPA, Electric School Buses. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: EPA, Electric School Buses

description: EquiMania!™, is an award-winning equine educational exhibit that was developed at the University of Guelph in Ontario, Canada, in the form of a traveling exhibit. The Minnesota State Fair has partnered with EquiMania™  to create a replica of the traveling exhibit to be housed in the Horse Barn at the Minnesota State Fair. The exhibit includes stations covering a variety of horse topics.
name: EquiMania!™

description: Presented by the Minnesota 4-H Ambassadors. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: Experience MN 4-H at the State Fair

description: Minneapolis-based with roots in northern Minnesota, dynamic singer-songwriter Faith Boblett creates timeless songs with lyrics and instrumentals that reach a wide range of listeners. With authenticity and depth, she continues to develop her own brand of pop, Americana, rock and alt-country.
name: Faith Boblett

description: Master Gardener Kim Sullivan talks about what should be done to our lawns this autumn. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Fall Lawn Care for Low Input Lawns

description: FFA members participate in livestock competitions along with Agriculture Technology exhibits in the Education Building; Crops exhibits in the Agriculture Horticulture Building; Christensen Farms Stage demonstrations; the CHS Miracle of Birth Center; and Landscape Design and Construction exhibits outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center. In addition, the FFA Leadership Center at the CHS Miracle of Birth Center is open daily.

description: Limousin, Hereford, Charolais, Simmental, Red Angus, Foundation Simmental, unregistered commercial beef cattle and breeding heifer showmanship exhibitors are judged in the FFA beef cattle competition in the north ring of Compeer Arena.
name: FFA Beef Cattle

description: All other wool breeds, Babydoll Southdown, Columbia, Corriedale, Natural Colored, Rambouillet, Hampshire, Suffolk, Dorset, Southdown and other meat breeds in the FFA sheep competition are judged in the east ring of the Robert A. Christensen Pavilion.
name: FFA Breeding Sheep

description: Demonstration of daily winners presented by Minnesota FFA. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: FFA Champions of the Day

description:
In the Compeer Arena South Ring, Advanced showmanship exhibitors, Purebred Holstein, Jersey, Red & White, and MDA Special (Seven Best Dairy Animals) in the FFA dairy cattle competition.

In the Compeer Arena north ring, junior and senior showmanship, Grade Holstein, Guernsey, Ayrshire, Brown Swiss, Milking Shorthorn and all other breeds are judged in the FFA dairy cattle competition.
name: FFA Dairy Cattle

description: On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: FFA Foundation Telethon

description: Teams create a display that incorporates any plant material that will tolerate and thrive in an area with sun or shade. This competition is displayed outside just east of the CHS Miracle of Birth and FFA Chapter House & Leadership Center.
name: FFA Landscape Design & Construction Judging

description: Commercial breeding ewes, market lambs and exhibition-only animals are judged in the FFA sheep competition in the east ring of the Robert A. Christensen Pavilion.
name: FFA Market Sheep

description: Market goats breeding meat-type doelings, dairy and meat market goats and showmanship exhibitors in the FFA goat competition are judged in the west ring of the Robert A. Christensen Pavilion.
name: FFA Meat Goats

description: Market, egg production and breeding chickens, and other poultry are judged in the FFA poultry competition.
name: FFA Poultry

description: Breeding rabbits - small breeds, breeding rabbits - large breeds and market rabbits are judged in the FFA rabbit competition.
name: FFA Rabbits

description: Participating FFA members will compete in two heats of five individual students. Students must dissassemble an engine down to the bare block and individual parts, and reassemble within the given timeframe.
name: FFA Small Engine Build Off

description: All other breeds, Berkshire, Chester White, Crossbred Gilts, Duroc, Hampshire, Landrace, Poland China, Spotted Hogs, Yorkshire, market hogs and for exhibition-only animals are judged in the FFA swine competition in the west ring of the Robert A. Christensen Pavilion.
name: FFA Swine

description: Participating FFA members will be given 90 minutes to weld and complete a metal campfire grate. Held outside the Miracle of Birth Center.
name: FFA Weld Off

description: Teams of two FFA members from the same FFA chapter will be given a two-hour window to complete a wooden bench.
name: FFA Wood Construction Build Off

description: Detective quiz sends participants on a hunt through our gallery. Hone your observational skills and earn a ribbon with a completed quiz. Two levels of difficulty are available makes this fun for all ages.
name: Fine Arts Detective

description:
Visit Minnesota’s largest juried art exhibition showcasing more than 300 of the finest pieces of artwork selected from thousands entered by artists throughout the state.

Studio: HERE: watch art being made as artists use the Fine Arts Center gallery space as their studio-away-from-studio for the day. Play Be a Fine Arts Detective: A fun sleuthing activity for all ages.
name: Fine Arts Center

description: A variety of fire prevention activities will take place on the north side of the DNR Building. Test your knowledge and win fun temporary tattoos and other prizes.
name: DNR: Fire Prevention Activities

description: Visit a DNR fire tower cab (lookout) without climbing the stairs. Discover the importance of fire towers to Minnesota’s history.
name: DNR: Fire Prevention Building

description:
Join us as First Avenue Goes To The Fair with Al Church and The Congregation, hosted by Diane Miller. This two-day showcase features a variety of local artists from Minnesota’s music scene. Expect great live music, a few surprises and a lot of local love at the Great Minnesota Get-Together this summer.

Featured on Friday, Aug. 30, are Fanaka Nation, Jake Balistrieri and Sarah Mevissen from Pit Stop, Lars Pruitt from Yam Haus, student 1 and The Foxgloves. Featured on Saturday, Aug. 31, are Anderson Daniels, Ashley Ackerson, Ava Levy, Pop Wagner and REIKI.
name: First Avenue Goes To The Fair

description: See native fish swimming in the outdoor pond and learn more about them from DNR fishing educators and volunteers. At the Fish Pond at DNR Park, on the north side of Judson Avenue between Clough and Nelson streets.
name: DNR: Fish Pond Talks

description: Flag-raising ceremonies occur before the 10:30 a.m. Leinie Lodge Bandshell show.
name: Flag Raising

description: Music by FlashMob at Dino's Gyros.
name: FlashMob

description: Karen Ortiz of Len Busch Roses gives a demonstration in floral design. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Floral Design Demo

description: Live finals of the Minnesota State Florist Association's Professional Designer of the Year Competition.
name: Minnesota State Florist Association's Professional Designer of the Year Competition

description:
France 44 Cheese Shop will demonstrate the process of pulling fresh mozzarella at 10 a.m., noon, 2 p.m. and 4 p.m.

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.
name: France 44 Cheese Shop

description: A take-a-break oasis for guests of all ages who may find the sights, sounds, smells and crowds overwhelming; staffed by Fraser-trained sensory support volunteers. Located on the west side of Cosgrove St., south of the Home Improvement Building.
name: Fraser Sensory Building

description: Jeremy Pryes from Pryes Brewing / Idyll Forest will present "From Barrel to Bottle - Everything Mixed Culture / Spontaneous."
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: From Barrel to Bottle

description: When a black/red grape suddenly drops its pigmentation, wonderful things can happen. This is how Pinot Grigio was born from Pinot Noir. It’s happening now in Minnesota, as Frontenac Gris and Frontenac Blanc bring us some of the best new white wines in the state. Learn about pigment mutations while tasting great examples. Presented by Jason Kallsen, founder of Twin Cities Wine Education, at Minnesota Wine Country.
name: Frontenac Gris & Blanc: The Mysterious Mutations That Are Making Great New Wines

description: Music by the Gary West at BOB FM.
name: Gary West

description: German shepherd dogs will show their abilities through demonstrations of obedience, tricks and behaviors, and conformation. Fairgoers will be introduced to a variety of types of German shepherds within the breed.

description: Come learn all about this wonderful breed and see what kind of activities you can do with your dog.
name: German Shorthaired Pointer Club of Minnesota

description: Learn about everyone’s favorite fish in the pond in an immersive VR video featuring CFANS’ “gar guy,” Solomon David. Drop by the CFANS wing of the Agriculture Horticulture Building to get your plant questions answered by Master Gardeners. Touch grass and ask U of M turfgrass experts your lawn care questions. Find out what new, sustainable crops are on the horizon from Forever Green researchers. Drop by daily for pop-up learning hosted by University of Minnesota departments.
name: Get Hooked on Gar: A Fresh Look at an Ancient Fish

description: Sing in a field of microphones karaoke-style. Located north of Lee Ave. between Underwood & Cooper streets.

description: Get answers to questions about such things as the tassels that hang from a goat’s neck (they’re called wattles), how much milk goats produce, why some goat breeds have such different-looking ears, and more. Plus, see a goat anatomy model. (The Goat Booth is open for the last four days of fair.)
name: Goat Booth

description: Presented by Minnesota Turkey. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: Virtual Turkey Tours with “Turkey Jake”

description: Promotion and sales of Good Health Saunas. Located on Randall Ave., south of The North Woods.
name: Good Health Saunas

name: GoRVing

description: Various award presentations as part of Governor's Fire Prevention Day.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day: Explorer Challenge Award Ceremony

description: Fire Explorer Posts (ages 14-21) from around the state will compete and show off their skills. Events include a ladder raise, gear donning, search and rescue, CPR, spinal immobilization, a firefighter relay, and public education presentations. The gear-donning finals will be held on stage at 5 p.m. Part of Governor's Fire Prevention Day.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day: Fire Explorer Competition

description: Engage, entertain and educate regarding fire prevention. Part of Governor's Fire Prevention Day.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day: Hot Zone

description: Come watch a demonstration on vehicle extrication tools. One of the Explorer posts will demonstrate how firefighters can use extrication tools to gain access to a vehicle after a crash. Part of Governor's Fire Prevention Day.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day: Mock Car Crash Scene Demonstration

description: Come watch demonstrations, presentations and interactive games to learn how to keep you and your family safe. Part of Governor's Fire Prevention Day.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day: Quiz Show & Entertainment

description: The governor, commissioner of public safety, state fire marshal, chaplain and MFFMA will speak. Part of Governor's Fire Prevention Day.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day: State of Fire Prevention Address

description: Don’t miss Governor’s Fire Prevention Day activities at the North End, Dan Patch Park and DNR Park. Learn life-saving measures and see the impressive work firefighters do for their communities.
name: Governor's Fire Prevention Day

description: Grace Dunavan and her band, Gracenotes, embody music as the language of the soul. This band has earned a reputation as talented musicians and skillful performers. Repertoire ranges from Norah Jones to Maroon Five, from Billie Holiday to Corinne Bailey Ray. Their contemporary jazz and soft rock can be heard in venues around the Twin Cities. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR: Gracenotes

description: Cheese carving contest with prizes in 3 age categories. Sign-up begins at 4 p.m. Presented by Dinner Bell Creamery. On the Moo Stage at the Moo Booth, outside the northwest corner of the Cattle Barn.

description: Golden Retrievers will perform agility, obedience, flyball, conformation and other special tricks.

name: Green Mill Restaurant

description: Green or Not with Ramy Selim and Jason S. of Sunny Day Solutions. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: Green or Not

description: Featuring some of the best musicians in the region, country-rock ‘n’ blues band Gregg Hall & The Wrecking Ball prove to be a force in the Midwest music scene. Hailing from the driftless area of southwest Wisconsin, songwriter Gregg Hall returns to his country roots and backwoods upbringing, writing about heartache and the hard times that come from living on the edge of life.
name: Gregg Hall & The Wrecking Ball

description: A conversation on growing apples in Minnesota by John Jacobson, one of the owners of Pine Tree Apple Orchard. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Growing Apples in Minnesota

description: Master Gardener Paul Richtman has sweet advice on growing blueberries in your own yard. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Growing Blueberries

description: A discussion with the experts at Gerten's Garden Center about various garden trends, designs and styles. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Growing Gorgeous Gardens

description: Master Gardener Dave Knapp has proven tips for growing tomatoes in your garden. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Growing Tomatoes Outside

description: Are you curious about homebrewing with local ingredients? Linda Rae Holcomb and Mary Nieting from Gluek Beer will discuss growing your homebrew garden.
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: Growing Your Homebrew Garden

description: Established in 2010, Minnesota band Grupo Esplendor Norteño plays traditional music from the northern part of Mexico using drums, electric bass, 10-string guitar and the accordion, which is the main instrument in this music genre. Though the five members of the band come from different musical influences, all are united in their passion for Norteño music.
name: Grupo Esplendor Norteño

description: Karl Eicher and David Stennes of Haggard Barrel Brewing will present how Arcola Farms and Haggard have partnered to showcase a new trademarked perennial grain from Kansas that is gaining traction because of its potential positive impact on farming and environmental practices. They will detail how this grain is used in brewing and its potential for sustainable brewing.
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: Haggard Barrel Brewing & Arcola Farms

description: Music by the Hailey James at BOB FM.
name: Hailey James

description: Live honey extraction demonstration. See how honey makes it way from beehive to bottle. Learn about the different varieties of honey. Located in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Harvesting Honey

description: Let HIGI check your blood pressure. These high tech machines will measure your systolic and diastolic pressures. See what other health information they can determine. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Blood Pressure Checks

description: Public health outreach takes many forms. Representatives with Pillsbury United Community will share their experiences of providing health care at the grassroot level. Learn what it takes to become a frontline worker in the health-care world. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Careers in Public Health

description: Seasonal influenza vaccinations, for those 5 and older, administered by Cub Pharmacy. Bring proof of insurance. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Flu Shots

description: Help is available for people living with kidney disease. Talk one-on-one with people who have experience with it. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Kidney Disease Support

description: With just a couple drops of blood, Memorial Blood Centers can tell you what type of blood you have flowing through your veins. Must be 16 or older. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Learn Your Blood Type

description: Help is available for patients and family members dealing with pancreatic cancer. Talk one-on-one with people who have dealt with it. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Living with Pancreatic Cancer

description: Check out the giant-sized lung display and talk with lung health experts about ways to improve your lung function. Find out if you're eligible for a chest scan. Assessments are conducted by a coalition of lung health experts from across Minnesota and the Breath of Hope Foundation. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Lung Health Assessment

description: Is your forgetfulness a normal symptom of aging or a sign of early Alzheimer's disease? Take a simple screening and talk with the pros from Suite Living Senior Care to learn more. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Memory Assessment

description: SHOUT OUT LOUD aims to bring awareness to suicide prevention and normalize the conversation about suicide prevention. Learn coping skills and everyday activities that help with a person’s mental wellness. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Mental Health Help & Suicide Prevention

description: Cannabis is medicine. There are two organizations approved in Minnesota to participate in the state's medical cannabis program. Learn which health conditions are eligible for cannabis treatments. Talk with tGreen Goods experts every day of the fair. RISE will have staff during the final weekend of the fair. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Minnesota's Medical Cannabis Program

description: Overdose Awareness Day is Aug. 31. Talk with family members who have lost loved ones to opioid overdoses. Two grassroots nonprofit groups have specialized outreach materials to share. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Opioid Addiction & Recovery

description: It's a struggle living with a family member dealing with addiction. Talk face-to-face with people who have experience. The MN Adult and Teen Challenge have tools available to battle addiction. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Overdose Prevention & Family Support

description: Sickle Cell Disease is the most common genetic disorder in the U.S. Talk one-on-one with families living with this condition. Sickle Cell Foundation of MN is an advocacy organization for patients and their family members. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Sickle Cell Disease Support

description: For more than a decade Raising Our Celiac Kids-Twin Cites has compiled the official Gluten-free Fair Foods list. Stop by to test your GF knowledge. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: State Fair Gluten-Free Food List & GF Jeopardy

description: Early detection saves lives. Find information about treatment and resources for breast cancer patients. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Support for Breast Cancer Patients & their Families

description: For more than a decade Raising Our Celiac Kids-Twin Cites has compiled the official Gluten-free Fair Foods list. Stop by to test your GF knowledge. The Anaphylaxis and Food Allergy Association is a statewide all-volunteer nonprofit dedicated to food allergy advocacy. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Take the Fear Out of Living with Food Allergies

description: Get your child's vision checked for issues that could affect their ability to see and learn. Children who are screened get free sunglasses courtesy of the MD5M Lions KidSight Foundation. For children 6 months to 16 years. Located at Health Fair 11.
name: Health Fair 11: Vision Checks

description: Free or low-cost health checks and info, flu shots, gluten-free fair food list, vision and memory checks, blood typing and more.
name: Health Fair 11

description: Anne Saweyer of the Board of Water and Soil Resources talks about creating healthy soil. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Healthy Soil, Healthy Plants!

description: Music by Heart of the City at Crossroads Chapel and Stage.
name: Heart of the City

description: Music by Heart Song at Crossroads Chapel and Stage.
name: Heart Song

description: Music by Heart Tribute Giggles' Campfire Grill.
name: Heart Tribute

description:
Heaven Gluten Free Bakery will focus on handcrafted loaves of gluten free bread. Learn more about their bread products which are naturally fermented without any yeast, dairy, soy, eggs or preservatives and are designed to promote a healthy microbiome.

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.
name: Heaven Gluten-Free Bakery

description: Music by the Hell Country Truckers at BOB FM.
name: Hell Country Truckers

description: Elaine Evans and R. Zerlin of UMN Bee Lab explain how you too can help pollinators deal with climate change. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: Help Pollinators Deal with Climate Change

description: Wisconsin-based quartet High & Rising plays a unique combination of instruments to bring a fresh groovy sound to bluegrass and folk-Americana music. Their prolific songwriting and uplifting performances are gaining them recognition in the Upper Midwest music scene.
name: High & Rising

description: A centerpiece of the West End Market, the History & Heritage Center showcases the competition, entertainment, agriculture, food, merchandise, rides and games and Minnesota industry that have been the heart of the fair for more than 160 years. Developed in partnership with the Minnesota Historical Society and the Minnesota State Fair Foundation, the center reflects the progression of change at the fair. Exhibits bring to life the significant events, intriguing stories and inspiring traditions that have laid the foundation for the present-day Great Minnesota Get-Together. Located at West End Market. Free with fair admission.
name: History & Heritage Center

description: Embark on this free, self-guided tour to discover State Fair history, presented by the Minnesota State Fair Foundation and the Minnesota Historical Society. Pick up a brochure at any of the 12 stops on the fairgrounds — complete 8 or more and earn a prize. Prize pickup will take place at the History & Heritage Center, or Minnesota Historical Society booth SW of the DNR Building daily from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m., and 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. on Labor Day. They will also be available outside the J.V. Bailey House daily from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m., and 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. on Labor Day.
name: History Walking Tour

description: Now in its ninth year, Hmong Minnesota Day at Dan Patch Park is about hope, healing and a celebration of life. Stage activities feature a collaboration of Hmong artists and organizations from throughout Minnesota, including singers, dancers, martial artists, community leaders and more for all to enjoy.
name: Hmong Minnesota Day at Dan Patch Park

description: Come in to the Home Improvement Building to learn about (and purchase!) products and services for do-it-yourselfers and those hiring a contractor. Located between Cooper and Cosgrove streets, north of Dan Patch Avenue.

description: Abby Rouster, Matt Johnson, and Dave Matson from the MN Homebrewers Association will announce the winners of the Minnesota State Fair Homebrew Competition.
name: Homebrew Competition Winner Announcement

description: See young drivers show us what they've got (behind the reins) in the Minnesota junior driver cart class and see the beautiful draft horses being driven around the arena.

description: Watch these majestic gentle giants barrel into the Coliseum and race around. Draft horses are not commonly ridden, so this is a sight to behold.
name: Horse Show: Draft Horse Barrel Racing

description: See iconic Belgian, Clydesdales and Percheron draft horses being led, not ridden, around the ring.

name: Horse Show: Miniature Driving, Walking Horse, Western Pleasure & Horsemanship Classes

description: Four-in-line barrel racing and championships in jumping figure 8, pole weaving and barrel racing. Horse and rider teams with the top times from previous days compete in this fast-paced show.

description: Watch horse and rider perform numerous skills in speed events, including pole weaving, barrel racing and jumping figure 8.

description: Jason Dayton, president of the Minnesota Cider Guild, will discuss how Minnesota cider goes from farm to table.
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: How It's Made: Minnesota Cider

name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: How the Germans Saved a Drunken Nation

description: Ramy Selim of Sunny Day Solutions discusses how to design and build a tiny house that works for you. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: How to Design and Build a Tiny House

description: Don't have garden tools? No problem! Master Gardener Larry Cipolla shows you how to garden with the tools you have. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.

description: Learn how to grow giant pumpkins and other garden vegetables from Chris Brown of Garden of Giants. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.

description: Philippe Gallandat of Swiss Gardens discusses how to keep your shrubs and trees healthy. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: How to Repair/Restore Wounds & Prevent Damages to Shrubs and Trees

description:
Alive and Kickin' gives voices to seniors through personal stories and popular songs, empowering its members to entertain and enlighten multi-generational audiences.  The highly inspirational group of spirited and charismatic seniors spread their musical message as they explore contemporary genres of music ranging from rock ‘n’ roll and pop to gospel and Motown.

Part of Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day: Alive and Kickin'

description: Featuring radio and podcast appearances from Hubbard Broadcating, plus live music performances in Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park

description:
Maybe you want to hear a little more from KS95’s Morning Show hosts Crisco, Dez and Wes talking about their lives and things they don’t always share on the air.

Part of Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day: KS95’s After Hours Podcast

description:
KS95’s Morning Show co-host Dez and her husband, Taylor, are the duo Dez and Taylor.  With a mix of crowd favorite songs and originals,  Dez and Taylor make every performance a hit.

Part of Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day: KS95’s Dez and Taylor Live Performance

description:
Purple Daily is Minnesota Vikings entertainment with one mission: We want the Vikings to win the Super Bowl before we die.  Purple Daily is hosted by Phil Mackey and Judd Zulgad, who are joined daily by Executive Producer, Declan Goff.  Phil and Judd are long-time radio and podcast hosts in the Twin Cities and former Vikings beat writers.

Part of Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day: Purple Daily

description:
Staci and Hutch are your entertaining friends from 2 p.m.-7 p.m. on KS95 in the Twin Cities. On the Say Too Much podcast, you’ll hear them say and do things they can’t typically say on the radio.

Part of Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day: Staci & Hutch Say Too Much Podcast

description:
After a 35+ year run on radio, Tom Barnard left to pursue a new project – The Tom Barnard Podcast.​ Tom’s Podcast can be found on Spotify, Apple, PodMN or wherever you find your favorite podcasts, or watch the show posted on YouTube.  Plus, you can listen to Tom LIVE weekday on the Tom Barnard app, or at TomBarnardShow.com. He is joined by regular guests like Bob Sansevere, Chris Egert, Phil Mackey, Judd Zulgad, Tim Lammers, Elizabeth Burtt.  Who will join Tom live on stage is anybody’s guess, but you know there will be great conversation, laughter, life talk, and whatever else occurs to them.​

Part of Hubbard Broadcasting Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Hubbard Broadcasting Day: Tom Barnard Morning Show Podcast

description: Sales of Human Touch zero gravity lounge/office chairs and massage therapy chairs. Located on the corner of Wright Ave. & Cooper St.
name: Human Touch

description: Music by Hunter Fraser at Crossroads Chapel and Stage.

description: North American Traditional Indigenous Food Systems (NĀTIFS) will be joined by guest chefs to present cooking demonstrations and discuss the foundations of Indigenous food systems. Indigenous music and learning activities for all ages.

description: Performance by The Kalpulli KetzalCoatlicue ("Precious Mother Earth"), a Kalpulli ("learning community") of Indigenous people, will share the tradition of Aztec dance. KetzalCoatlicue pursues this spiritual, mental and physical vocation with music from the sacred drum, conch shells, seeds and other instruments made from the natural environment. Group members range in age from toddlers to elders. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Indigenous Peoples' Day: Aztec Dance Group

description: Representatives from the Red Lake Nation Department of Agriculture discuss the cultural significance and traditional uses of the buffalo. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Indigenous Peoples' Day: Buffalo Presentation

description: Ben Weaver and Strong Buffalo perform sing and play instruments with a traditional sound. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Indigenous Peoples' Day: Buffalo Weavers Musical Performance

name: Indigenous Peoples' Day: Closing Drum Group

description: The opening drum circle will return to "drum" excitement for the afternoon programming. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.

description: Linda Black Elk provides education on foraging in Minnesota. She will highlight the plants that can be found all over the fairgrounds. Helpers will hand out a scavenger hunt for people to find these plants and winners will receive a prize. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.
name: Indigenous Peoples' Day: Edible & Medicinal Plants

description: An introduction to North American Traditional Indigenous Food Systems (NĀTIFS). Learn from each department about the work they do, their goals and how folks in the audience and community can support them. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.

description: The Twin Cities Native Lacrosse Association will provide an overview on this game and hands-on learning. Part of Indigenous Peoples' Day at Dan Patch Park.

description: Luke and Linda Black Elk will demonstrate traditional Indigenous food presrevation techniques that will take you from the abundant summer months through long winters. name: Indigenous Peoples' Day: Traditional Food Preservation Demonstration

description:
Interact Theater’s company of actors with disabilities creates all original work, sustains rigorous professional standards, and explores ideas through the lens of the entire spectrum of disability labels. Their uncompromising vision of radical inclusion dissolves concepts of who “can” or “cannot,” blending the talents and viewpoints of artists with and without disabilities, and artists from mainstream and marginalized communities. They are pleased to be returning to the State Fair this year after a short hiatus and hope you enjoy their wacky and wild performances!

Catch Interact Center for the Visual and Performing Arts in these pop-up performances at East Grandstand Plaza. Part of the 2024 Arts A'Fair program.
name: Interact Center for the Visual and Performing Arts

description: The Midwest’s premier reggae band for more than 20 years, The International Reggae All Stars are truly a global band with members hailing from Venezuela to Trinidad to Ghana to Jamaica. description: Combining Tex-Mex conjunto, Texas rock, blues and R&B riffs, Los Texmaniacs delight audiences with a sound solidly rooted in tradition while exploding with contemporary vitality. description: Singer-songwriter Mae Simpson writes music with passion, soul and a rawness reflected in each lyric. Backed by an extremely talented and passionate band, her shows consist of an uncontainable energy that radiates from stage with a broad collection of soul, funk and rock-inspired original music that refuses to fall neatly into a single genre.
name: Mae Simpson

description: Music is a powerful means of expression, and rarely has a young performer displayed better command than singer-songwriter Maggie Rose. Unencumbered by genre, she does everything completely and with unflinching honesty. Showcasing a strong, warm voice that is alternately playful or poignant, her gift for penning insightful songs and delivering them with emotional punch is evident. Known for her blend of rock, soul and Americana-folk stylings, she has crafted albums filled with potent songs, each one anchored by her riveting vocals.
name: Maggie Rose

Learn about how this ancient beverage is experiencing a renaissance right here in Minnesota.  Presented by Kyle Peterson, owner of Winehaven Winery, at Minnesota Wine Country.

description: Premier American musical ensemble Mariachi Campanas de America fascinates audiences with the ability to combine traditional Mexican mariachi music with Latin and mainstream pop rhythms. These multitalented musicians create innovative mariachi music with the use of accordion, saxophone and keyboard for unmatched versatility, enhancing nontraditional music while preserving the authentic sounds of mariachi music.

description: World yo-yo champion and cool guy Mark Hayward makes a career out of playing with toys. With an amusing combination of comedy and object manipulation, he uses yo-yos, spinning tops, juggling equipment and nontraditional props like mousetraps to create a fun and witty show for the whole family.

description: Best known for the 15 years spent drumming for The Ramones, Marky Ramone performed in more than 1,700 shows and more than 15 releases during his tenure with the band. An American punk rock band formed in New York City, The Ramones are often cited as the first true punk band and are known for helping establish the punk movement. Popular songs in their catalogue include “I Wanna Be Sedated,” “Judy Is a Punk,” “I Wanna Be Your Boyfriend,” “Sheena Is a Punk Rocker,” “Rock & Roll High School” and “Blitzkrieg Bop,” among others. In 2002, the original four members and Marky Ramone were inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in their first year of eligibility, and in 2011, they were awarded a GRAMMY Lifetime Achievement Award. Marky Ramone continues to tour the world with his band, Marky Ramone’s Blitzkrieg.
name: Marky Ramone Plays The Ramones Classics

description: Mortagon Lilies are highlighted by Luminita Vollmer. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.

description: Join 8-year-old puppet Mason as he discovers the biodiversity of Minnesota. He befriends a Mason Bee and learns more about pollination and the bee life cycle. name: Mason Meets A Mason Bee

description: The Masonic Cancer Center is proud to host Goldy vs. Cancer Day at the State Fair. Researchers will educate and engage fairgoers on the work being done to reduce the burden of cancer for Minnesotans. Games and activities on the University of Minnesota stage will include prizes, but will inspire the scientist in all of us.
name: Masonic Cancer Center's Goldy vs. Cancer Day

description: Pull a rope to flap the wings on our giant monarch butterfly. Minnesota’s state butterfly, the monarch, is one of the most recognizable species in North America. As an insect pollinator, its well-being depends on a healthy habitat, which includes clean water, clean air and a healthy climate. This butterfly is an ambassador for the plight of pollinators in our state and the many things we can do to protect them. Pollinators sustain and enhance our economy, maintain natural ecosystems and contribute to climate resiliency. Located in Eco Experience.
name: Massive Minnesota Monarch

description: Featuring The KAJ Orchestra led by Kirk A. Johnson, The Men of Motown presents the music of Stevie Wonder, Smokey Robinson, Marvin Gaye, The Jackson 5, The Four Tops and The Temptations performed by The Mfellaz. The iconic songs in this dynamic and soulful show transport audiences back in time to the creation of Motown’s danceable arrangements and choreography.

description: The Garden Club of Minneapolis presents floral arrangements, horticulture, artistic crafts and educational displays. The theme this year is "Minnesota Garden Party." (Show is closed until noon Aug. 28 for judging.)

description: Abraham Westlund is strongly influenced by the community, culture and sounds of his hometown. He was drawn to music and musicians at a very young age. He understands the power of sound and tries to perform music that speaks to fans across the musical spectrum.  "As an artist I put my emotions and stories of the things I have been through in hope to reach others who have gone through the same things," he says. Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park: Abraham Westlund

description: Annie Mack is an accomplished singer-songwriter and healing justice activist. As a queer Black woman, creative person, mother of three, and radical truth-teller, Annie’s lived experience provides a deep wealth of knowledge and insight into what it is like to navigate systems while trying to pursue joy, healing and justice. A soulful singer and unflinching songwriter, Annie writes from the gut and demands attention. Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park: Annie Mack

description: Eli Gardiner is a songwriter from the Upper Peninsula of Michigan, but is now based in Minneapolis. He has been writing and performing for more than 20 years. Midwest Music in Minnesota says, "Gardiner has a voice that conveys the pieces inside of us that can't always speak. Relatable, soulful and honest, his songwriting is structured in observations. He's a modern voice to old problems that continue to haunt our society." Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park: Eli Gardiner

description: Performance by Minnesota-native Elska and songwriting partner Owen Sartori. Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park: Elska & Owen Sartori

description: Performance by the Mississippi Ojibwe Drum Group. Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park: Mississippi Ojibwe Drum Group

description: Red Tree Singers is from the Lower Sioux community in southwestern Minnesota. The people from Lower Sioux – or the Mdewakanton Dakota – are also known as Cansayapi oyate, meaning “the people from where they paint the trees red.” Members have danced, sung and drummed in ceremonies, sundances and pow wows all their lives. "This is our way of life. We sing around the drum for strength, happiness, and life for all people," members say. Without the drumbeat they would be lost. The drum keeps people happy and is the heartbeat of the people. Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park: Red Tree Drum Group

description: This is a day filled with interactive, engaging, educational and fun activities for peopole of all ages to explore mental health resources and information. More than 50 organizations from throughout Minnesota will havethe most cutting-edge information on mental health and mental wellness. Stage performances will include children's programming, cultural performances, youth performances, musicians, therapy animals, and more. There will also be a collaborative art project anyone can help with as they walk through the park. Presented by NAMI Minnesota & Minnesota State Advisory Council on Mental Health and Subcommittee on Children’s Mental Health. Part of Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park.
name: Mental Health Awareness at Dan Patch Park

description: Metro Food Justice Network (MFJN) is a collaboration of individuals and organizations in the Twin Cities partnering to advance racial equity by transforming our food system. description: Once again ready to push the boundaries of their genre, Nashville-based indie alt-rock band Moon Taxi is back with a sixth full-length album, “Set Yourself Free.” With tracks ranging from rock to synth to pop to bluegrass, the new lineup showcases what 15 years as a band gets you: a polished, classic sound without fear of exploration. The five band members stepped back into their roots to create an album primarily written and recorded by themselves. Despite a more fragmented process, the band regards “Set Yourself Free” as more reminiscent of their early work, citing it as fresh and exciting. They believe the album will become a fan favorite, something that will re-energize the initial fan base as well as draw in new listeners. Without a set sound in mind, the group was free to mold the record into what feels like an authentic Moon Taxi album.
name: Moon Taxi

description: Since his songwriting career blossomed in the mid-‘90s, American country music artist Phil Vassar has accumulated a catalog of signature songs with 10 No. 1 singles and 27 Top 40 hits, including “Carlene,” “Just Another Day in Paradise,” “Six-Pack Summer,” “When I Love You,” and many more. His solo recording career has seen the release of nine albums, two ASCAP Songwriter of the Year trophies, ACM’s Top New Male Vocalist and sold-out shows across the country. His “Songs From The Cellar” airs nationally on Circle Network and features conversations and musical collaborations with artists, songwriters, entertainers and athletes. His laidback style and quick wit bring out interesting and entertaining stories with every guest.
name: Phil Vassar

description:

The fermenting process is older than recorded history and integral to culinary traditions in almost every part of the world. Demonstrations at 10 a.m., 11:45 a.m., 1:30 p.m., 3:15 p.m., 5 p.m.

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.

description:
Explore the demonstration pollinator gardens to envision what you can do in your own outdoor space. Speak to Blue Thumb Partners and grab free resources to get started on a project. There will be plant lists, design templates, step-by-step guides, coloring sheets, goodies and more. Learn about different native plants you can plant to create pollinator habitats, manage stormwater runoff and support soil health. Get to know our state pollinators, the Rusty Patched bumblebee and Monarch butterfly, and grab a pollinator button upon completing our Dakota Native Plant Names activity.

Located in Eco Experience.

description: Minnesotans throw away 3.3 million tons of garbage every year. This impacts our air, water and land. It has health impacts for people and animals. To decrease these negative impacts, let’s first reduce the amount of waste we throw away. Second, reuse and repair items, borrow, or buy things second hand. And third, recycle the proper material that so it gets another life. The exhibits in this area educate people on how to live a less-waste life and what happens to recycling once it leaves their curb. Minnesota’s recycling industry provides more than 78,000 direct and indirect jobs. Located in Eco Experience.
name: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle

description:
The Minnesota Department of Transportation, in partnership with Metro Transit, shares information that emphasizes environmental, personal, safety and financial benefits of choosing sustainable transportation options such as walking, biking, puboic transportation and carpooling. Learn about  transportation options that reduce carbon emissions and traffic congestion, save money and improve health and happiness. The life-sized public transit bus lets visitors take a turn driving the bus and an improved exhibit design will help you capture photos of this driving opportunity.  The Rolling in Green exhibit's interactive trivia board will help answer questions and highlight the many benefits of sustainable transportation options.

Located in Eco Experience.

description: Minneapolis rock band Semisonic, featuring GRAMMY-winning and Oscar-nominated lead vocalist Dan Wilson, John Munson and Jacob Slichter, is best known for the GRAMMY-nominated, massive hit single “Closing Time” and platinum album “Feeling Strangely Fine.” Semisonic also achieved international success with singles “Secret Smile” and “Singing In My Sleep.” Although the band never officially broke up, they parted ways in the early 2000s, periodically reuniting for one-offs and charity performances. During this hiatus, Wilson became one of the most in-demand songwriters in music and a 3x GRAMMY winner for his work with Adele, The Chicks and Chris Stapleton. In 2020, Semisonic reunited to release the band’s first music in 20 years with the critically acclaimed single and EP “You’re Not Alone.” In 2023, they released a full-length album, “Little Bit of Sun,” and toured the U.S. with Barenaked Ladies.
name: Semisonic

name: Summer Babies

description: Summit beers, including the new, exclusive Fair beer, served at Summit on a Stick. Located inside the International Bazaar entrance.
name: Summit Brewing Co.

description: Promotion of Sun Country Airlines card member services and giveaways. Located on Dan Patch Ave., south of the SkyGlider.
name: Sun Country Airlines

description: On Aug, 25, speaker is Melvin Miller and Progressive Baptist Band will provide music. On Sept. 1, speaker is Terry Baxter and Heart Song will provide music.
name: Sunday Worship Service

description:
Live spay/neuters done by veterinarians, aided by certified veterinary technicians. Minnesota veterinarian speakers narrate the surgery, answer questions, and educate the public on pet overpopulation. Forty-eight spay and neuter operations are performed over the course of the fair; cats and dogs from local human societies are then offered for adoption at their respective locations after the fair.

ASL interpretation offered daily at noon.
name: Pet Surgery Suite

description: Located in Eco Experience, the Sustainability Stage will feature a variety of presentations and speakers throughout the 12 days of the fair.
name: Sustainability Stage

description: Visit the T-Mobile booth to learn how you can score the best deal in wireless and home internet. Located on the corner of Judson Ave and Clough St, east of the Coliseum.
name: T-Mobile

description: Music by TC Hit Squad at Coasters Beer Garden. This group includesKris Vox of Hairball, Johnny Keyte of TPK, Tyler Azure of Almost Cooper, Jeff Rutland of PopROCKS and JJ Babcock of The Hype.
name: TC Hit Squad

description:
TeaSource, a Twin Cities tea destination, will hand out samples all day as well as have tips about brewing at home to make your best cup of tea. Explore their collection of high-quality loose leaf tea and enter for a chance to win a $100 TeaSource gift card.

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.
name: TeaSource

description: One of the most respected and accomplished artists in American roots music, Terrance Simien delivers his eclectic music artfully with complex vocal harmonies and a diverse repertoire. He and his highly skilled five-piece band create a hypnotic blend of New Orleans funk-world-blues-American-reggae-flavored zydeco roots music that beckons crowds to their feet and into the groove.
name: Terrance Simien and the Zydeco Experience

description:
Children of all ages are engaged while learning the important role that agriculture, farmers and ranchers play in their daily lives. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.

ASL interpretation offered daily at 1 p.m.
name: Thank a Farmer Magic Show

description: Stationed in Rosemount, the 34th Infantry Division "Red Bull" Band of the Minnesota National Guard performs throughout the region and world, sharing the story of the Minnesota Citizen Soldier. Proudly serving state and nation for more than 100 years, the unit provides music throughout the spectrum of military operations to instill the will to fight and win, foster the support of citizens, and promote national interests at home and abroad.
name: The 34th Infantry Division “Red Bull” Band

description: An ultimate blast from the past, The 70’s Magic Sunshine Band brings audiences back to the era of 8-tracks, polyester and bell bottoms with the greatest hits from 1970s AM radio. Get ready to boogie down and feel the funky vibes as the band’s high-energy performances fill the dance floor!
name: The 70’s Magic Sunshine Band

description: Nate Smith from Lagersmith will discuss the history and benefits of aluminum cans and how beer is packaged in them.
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: The Amazing Aluminum Can

description:
Loosen the lederhosen and watch demonstrations throughout the day. Learn about German recipes and techniques from the team at The Black Forest Inn.

Located in the Cambria Kitchen in the Creative Activities Building.
name: The Black Forest Inn

description: Delivering a premier Midwest-rooted tribute, The Brothers Allmanac play classics and deep cuts spanning the entirety of The Allman Brothers Band career. From the raw, emotional vocals, the spot-on guitar harmonies and the thundering double drums, audiences feel like they are really listening to The Allman Brothers.
name: The Brothers Allmanac

description: Now in its 35th year, The Cedar Cultural Center promotes intercultural appreciation and understanding though global music and dance. Come explore the vibrancy and diversity of the Twin Cities art scene as The Cedar presents The Global Get-Together with France's favorite Celtic folk-pop band Doolin' on Aug. 28 and the Ethiopian-inspired rhythms and jazz of Abinnet Berhanu's Ahndenet (Unity) featuring Genet Abate on Aug. 29.
name: The Cedar Cultural Center Presents The Global Get-Together

description:
A high-energy, hilarious one-man show, The Chipper Experience! Where Comedy & Magic Collide! is a family-friendly crowd-pleaser. For more than 20 years, award-winning comedy magician Chipper Lowell has been bringing his odd brand of infectiously amusing mayhem to audiences around the world.

ASL interpretation offered daily at 3:30 p.m.
name: The Chipper Experience! Where Comedy & Magic Collide!

description: This interactive exhibit inspires Minnesotans to get connected to the food they eat. The actions we take every day matter. Centering around six areas of action – buy local, eat local; grow food, nurture soil, promote justice and reduce waste  – The Common Table: Minnesota Eats exhibit provides a learning opportunity and takeaway for every age and interest. The exhibit features various garden types including an aquaponics system, more than 200 edible plants, an interactive foodscape and waste reduction kitchen as well as dirt and compost displays, all informed by members of the local food community.
name: The Common Table: Minnesota Eats

description: The Corny Truth takes you on a corn adventure to learn how this important crop and its part of your everyday life. Presented by the Minnesota Corn Growers. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: The Corny Truth - Minnesota Road Crew

description: Learn about plants that deer will not eat in your yard. Barbara Ronnigen of the Washington County Horticulture Society has the information. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: The Deer Won't Eat That?

description: Country music husband-and-wife duo The Dryes bring the stage to life with songs that range from rowdy to nostalgic, each one a tiny window into their lives. Proving to be a force to be reckoned with, Derek provides a steady backbone alongside Katelyn’s soulful sound to make music that ranges from upbeat dance tunes to emotional anthems.
name: The Dryes

description: Miracle of Birth Center staff, veterinarians and FFA members share stories from the farm. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: The Farmer and Veterinarian: Farm Stories

description: See demonstrations and performances from this community group on the Cosgrove Stage outside the Education Building.
name: The Four Dads

description: Catch The Gilbert & Sullivan Very Light Opera Company in these pop-up performances at West End Market! Part of the 2024 Arts A'Fair program.
name: The Gilbert & Sullivan Very Light Opera Company

description: The Great Minnesota Tap Water Taste Test with Stew Thornley of Minnesota American Water Works Association. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: The Great Minnesota Tap Water Taste Test

description: Pat Carey from Padraigs Brewing in Minneapolis will discuss the history of Irish beer.
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: The History of Irish Beer

description: Presented by Joe Beattie of Hastings En Protectors. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: The Inflation Reduction Act: What is it and how can it change our lives?

description: Music by The Jeff Gavin Band at O'Gara's.
name: The Jeff Gavin Band

description: Through years of working together, Brianna and Kurt Jorgensen developed a sound that is powerful and fresh, taking root in rock, blues and Americana soul. Backed by a solid six-piece band, the performances of this husband-and-wife team are genuine, soulful and relatable with an honest authenticity, which is both timeless and classic.
name: The Jorgensens

description: Music by The Kingery Family at Crossroads Chapel and Stage.
name: The Kingery Family

description: Connecting environmental education for all Minnesotans with Heidi Ferris. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: The Landscape Analysis Project

description: Jeremy Pryes from Pryes Brewing / Idyll Forest will provide a virtual tour of Pryes Brewery and discuss the importance of state-of-the-art equipment in the brewing industry.
name: Minnesota Craft Brewers Guild: The Latest In Brewing Technologies

description: Music by The Lonesome Losers at Dino's Gyros.
name: The Lonesome Losers

description: Fun puppet version of a family friendly classic story! The Lorax is a tale about over-consumption and environmental conservation. Presented by We All Need Food & Water. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: The Lorax

description: Becky DeLaCruz goes over the basics of food preservation. Presented by Master Gardener Hennepin County and Garden Club of Minneapolis. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: The Nuts and Bolts of Food Preservation

description: Presented by Minnesota Turkey. On the Christensen Farms Stage outside the CHS Miracle of Birth Center.
name: The Presidential Turkey

description:
The Raptor Center (TRC) is a world-renowned wildlife rehabilitation and education facility. Get a beak-to-nose experience with some of our educational ambassadors — owls, falcons, hawks and eagles. These birds cannot be released back into the wild, but they have a new job — teaching about their role in the environment and how we can all help them.TRC's educational programs are packed with information that is both educational and entertaining. This program is an experience that you won’t soon forget. On the DNR Garden Stage at DNR Park.

ASL interpretation available at 11 a.m.
name: DNR: The Raptor Center

description: Led by guitarist Robb Henry, The Robb Henry Trio plays an eclectic instrumental mix of jazz, blues, rock and ‘60s pop music. Their songs feature familiar melodies, unexpected excursions and sonic surprises that take listeners on a musical journey.
name: The Robb Henry Trio

description: Music by The Sam Kuusisto Band
name: The Sam Kuusisto Band

description: A collaboration between Daniel Murphy and Jeff Arundel, The Scarlet Goodbye is a musical adventure developed after a chance meeting between the two musicians. With incredible songwriting skills, strong melodies and tight, clean instrumentation, this unlikely duo artfully delivers songs that evoke the emotions of minor things in major keys.
name: The Scarlet Goodbye

description: Catch The State Fair Fitness Fanatics Comedy Show in these pop-up performances at West End Market! Part of the 2024 Arts A'Fair program.
name: The State Fair Fitness Fanatics Comedy Show

description: Music by The Summerbabies at O'Gara's.
name: The Summerbabies

description: Who is pollinating your favorite wildflowers? Is it a bee, butterfly, beetle or bird? Take part in the ultimate pollinator challenge and find out. This interactive quiz is led by Minnesota Parks and Trails naturalists. You can also find out what to plant to encourage pollinators to visit your own native wildflower garden. Kids to adults will enjoy this quiz. On the DNR Volunteer Outdoor Stage at DNR Park.
name: DNR: The Ultimate Pollinator Challenge – Family Quiz

description: The View from the Tractor Seat with Dave Legvold of Legvold Farms. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: The View from the Tractor Seat

description: Emerging as one of the most electrifying new acts in American music, The War & Treaty captivates audiences across the globe, recently earning the act’s first GRAMMY nominations for Best New Artist and Best American Roots Song, as well as a first Duo of the Year nomination from the Country Music Association and a first Vocal Duo nomination from the Academy of Country Music. In addition, this pair has received recognition from the Country Music Hall of Fame, Grand Ole Opry and American Music Association, including earning AMA Duo/Group of the Year for the second year in a row. This powerhouse husband-and-wife duo shares songs of reconciliation and humanity, blending roots, folk, gospel and soul to create music that is chilling, soulful and powerful. With their transcendent vocals, Tanya and Michael Trotter Jr. take listeners on a soaring, emotional ride with a sound that’s both stirring and sensual, driven by joy, determination and an unceasing upward gaze.
name: The War & Treaty

description: Music by The Whiskies at O'Gara's.
name: The Whiskies

description: Music by The White Keys at Cafe Caribe.
name: The White Keys

description: It’s a “big bright beautiful world” as everyone’s favorite ogre, Shrek, leads a cast of fairytale misfits on an adventure to rescue a princess and find true acceptance. The 45-minute performances begin at 9 a.m., 11:30 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. ETC Productions brings together performers and technicians ages 15-19 to present shows in communities around the metro and beyond.
name: Theater Day at Dan Patch Park: Shrek the Musical JR

description: Music by Them Pesky Kids at Coasters Beer Garden.
name: Them Pesky Kids

description: Music by the Thomas Sticha at BOB FM.
name: Thomas Sticha

description: Thomasina Petrus is a jazz singer, theater professional and entrepreneur. She is best known for her signature role of jazz icon Billie Holiday. In addition, she is a McKnight Theater Artist Fellow, Ivey Award winner and founder of the theater company Thomasina Productions.
name: Thomasina Petrus & The King's Quartet

description: After 25 years, the Timberworks Lumberjack Show continues captivating spectators with daring feats matching human against the impossible. World-class forest sports athletes compete in a decathlon of timber events designed to challenge even the hardiest lumberjacks. Flannel-clad woodsmen and women showcase their skills in single buck saw, obstacle pole, logroll, hot saw, speed climb and more. From the precision and control required for the axe throw to the power and technique needed for the springboard chop, audience members will see a wide variety of exciting, fast-paced events. Fun for the whole family!
name: Timberworks Lumberjack Show

description: Drawing creative energy from a wide spectrum of rock, soul, jazz and Americana, as well as singer-songwriters, Tina Schlieske has spent years honing her skills, writing songs and playing everywhere she could find a stage and cultivating a dedicated following. Originally hailing from Minneapolis, Minn., she captivates listeners with her impassioned vocal delivery and magnetic stage presence.
name: Tina Schlieske & Friends

description: Traditional Irish music by the duo Tom Dahill and Ginny Johnson at O'Gara's.
name: Tom Dahill and Ginny Johnson

description: Music by Tom Hunter at RC's BBQ.
name: Tom Hunter

description: Although singer-songwriter Tommy Prine grew up surrounded by music, learning fingerpicking from his father, country-folk musician John Prine, at the age of 10 and sometimes joining him on stage, he didn’t seriously consider music as a career until after his father’s death in 2020. Endeavoring to create distinct and independent music from his father, his songs are strong and introspective with a roots-rock edge that builds on established tradition while breaking free from the past.
name: Tommy Prine

description: Music by the Tony Cuchetti at BOB FM.
name: Tony Cuchetti

description: Master Gardener Larry Cipolla covers everything you need to know about growing tomatoes in Minnesota. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Totally Tomatoes

description: Learn all about Treasure Island's most recent promotions and walk away with some giveaways. Located on the corner of Wright Ave. & Underwood St.
name: Treasure Island Resort and Casino

description: Stop by the Treasure Island exhibit outside The Garden to win some fun prizes. Located on Dan Patch Ave., north of The Garden.
name: Treasure Island Resort and Casino

description: Music by Treehorn at Dino's Gyros.
name: Treehorn

description: Award-winning salsa fusion band Tropical Zone Orchestra breathes life into the rich musical heritage of Puerto Rico with swinging salsas, grooving merengues, cumbias and boleros. Their interpretive style and inventive musical flair make them a fast favorite among Twin Cities jazz and salsa fans.
name: Tropical Zone Orchestra

description: Music by Tru Serva at Crossroads Chapel and Stage.
name: Tru Serva

description: With a level of physical prowess and coordination rarely seen in juggling shows, Tuey uses charm, humor and awe-inspiring skill to captivate audiences. His show is a perfect blend of family-friendly comedy, jaw-dropping skills and danger.
name: Tuey

description: Patty Morrissey of FINNEGANS Community Fund discusses turning beer into food. On The DIRT stage in the Agriculture Horticulture Building.
name: Turning Beer into Food

description: Come see dogs run the agility course and show off their obedience training from basic to competition levels.
name: Twin Cities Obedience Training Club

description:
Twin Cities Trapeze Center is located in St Paul, Minn., and offers flying trapeze and circus classes to all ages and abilities.  You, yes you, can fly on the trapeze! This performance troupe uses classic circus techniques to awe, inspire and entertain!

Catch Twin Cities Trapeze in these pop-up performances at West End Market! Part of the 2024 Arts A'Fair program.
name: Twin Cities Trapeze

description: Ramy Selim and Kat of Sunny Day Solutions explain how a remodeling project can be sustainability responsible as well as artistic. On the Sustainability Stage in Eco Experience.
name: Tying Sustainability and Art Into a Remodel Project

description: UCare presents Seniors Day Stretch & Stroll Day at Dan Patch Park. See live musical and dance performances on the Outdoor Stage throughout the day with emcee Dave Lee. Fun is incorporated with health and wellness programming.
name: UCare Stretch & Stroll Day at Dan Patch Park

Peek into a retro viewer made by photography students at The Blake School, use a Secchi disk to learn about lake clarity, enter to win a kayak, learn about PFAS and "Amara's Law," win PFAS-free cookware and more. description:
Learn how the Metropolitan Council’s Environmental Services division converts the wastewater flushed from homes and businesses into water that is cleaner than most rivers and streams. There will be a multi-sensory exploration of the wonders of wastewater treatment. Sniff, touch, see, walk through and view interactive examples of how wastewater gets cleaned.

Located in Eco Experience.
name: Water Resource Recovery: Removing Poo for (Nearly) Pure Water

description:
Youth Performance Company (YPC) has been making BOLD, youth focused theater in the Twin Cities for more than 35 years. YPC puts the young artist at the center of their mission and brings their stories to life on stage. As part of Arts A'Fair, YPC will celebrate their more than 35 years of theater by performing songs from some of their most memorable shows. From Annie to Joseph and Frozen to Beauty and the Beast, YPC will celebrate the talent and spirit of the young artist!

Catch Youth Performance Company in these pop-up performances at West End Market! Part of the 2024 Arts A'Fair program.
name: Youth Performance Company

description:
The mission of Zorongo Flamenco Dance Theatre and School is to enrich the community by drawing people of diverse backgrounds close to the power, passion and virtuosity of the flamenco dance and music tradition, and by expanding on that tradition, to create an innovative art form that explores the issues of contemporary life.

Performances at the fair will include traditional flamenco dances done to live guitar and singing! Audience is invited to dance along at the end of each performance.

Catch Zorongo Flamenco Dance Theatre in these pop-up performances at West End Market! Part of the 2024 Arts A'Fair program.
name: Zorongo Flamenco Dance Theatre
